neighbors.name: Truong Hung Q
neighbors.claims: Hung Q. Truong is listed as the owner of two parcels in Orleans Parish, residing in New Orleans East – a community known for its predominantly Vietnamese-American population ([earthjustice.org](https://earthjustice.org/article/a-polluter-lies-to-new-orleans-city-council-still-gets-to-build-gas-plant#:~:text=At%20the%20same%20time%2C%20the,Reverend%20Gregory%20Manning%2C%20pastor%20of)). No references to Truong engaging in public meetings or local development debates were found in available news or civic records ([earthjustice.org](https://earthjustice.org/article/a-polluter-lies-to-new-orleans-city-council-still-gets-to-build-gas-plant#:~:text=At%20two%20city%20council%20meetings%2C,by%20Hurricane%20Katrina%20in%202005)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Initiate contact through neutral, informative outreach (e.g., a community meeting invite) to build trust and gauge his views.

neighbors.name: Brockhoeft Tetiana
neighbors.claims: Tetiana Brockhoeft appears as a private landowner in Orleans Parish with no discernible public profile or civic involvement ([www.ecowatch.com](https://www.ecowatch.com/entergy-gas-plant-lawsuits-2630271823.html#:~:text=Members%20of%20a%20coalition%20against,needed%20in%20the%20first%20place)). She has not made any publicly reported statements about local development or energy projects, and her engagement in community issues is not evident in official records ([www.ecowatch.com](https://www.ecowatch.com/entergy-gas-plant-lawsuits-2630271823.html#:~:text=Members%20of%20a%20coalition%20against,needed%20in%20the%20first%20place)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with general project information and an open offer for dialogue, as her interests and concerns are not publicly known.

neighbors.name: United States Of America
neighbors.claims: These parcels are federally owned land managed by the U.S. government ([earthjustice.org](https://earthjustice.org/article/a-polluter-lies-to-new-orleans-city-council-still-gets-to-build-gas-plant#:~:text=At%20the%20same%20time%2C%20the,Reverend%20Gregory%20Manning%2C%20pastor%20of)). As a governmental entity owner, it does not take a personal stance on local development; any project considerations would involve formal regulatory processes rather than individual advocacy ([earthjustice.org](https://earthjustice.org/article/a-polluter-lies-to-new-orleans-city-council-still-gets-to-build-gas-plant#:~:text=The%20New%20Orleans%20City%20Council,judge%20ruled%20on%20June%2014)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Not applicable – federal stakeholder; coordinate through official regulatory channels.

overview_summary: Both profiled neighbors have no documented stance on development or energy projects, and neither holds a notable public role in Orleans Parish. None are high-influence community leaders, suggesting limited impact on local development decisions.
